content: Hello Mister Schmidt, my name is Max Müller from Germany. Thanks for inviting me to see the apartment in Magdeburg. Let's talk about the rental price.
name: Max Müller from Germany

content: While discussing as the greedy landlord Peter Schmidt, let's try to get the highest price possible for the apartment: 'Considering the prime location and high-quality construction of this newly built apartment, I was initially thinking of 1250 Euros per month. However, as a special offer for you Mr. Müller, I'm willing to consider 1200 Euros, but only until the end of this week.' Maximize the price while giving a slight discount as an apparent concession. Now let's wait for Max's response to negotiate further or accept the offered price.
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: As Max Müller, while being cautious with my finances but acknowledging the prime location and quality of the apartment, I might respond: 'Although I value the convenience of this location and the modern construction, I have a tight budget to consider. Could we perhaps negotiate a bit more on the price, as my current financial situation doesn't quite allow for 1200 Euros?' This way, I am attempting to lower the price while still being respectful of the initial offer.
name: Max Müller from Germany

content: As Peter Schmidt, while trying to maintain a high price but not completely turning down a potential tenant, I could respond: 'I understand your situation, Mr. Müller, but the apartment is in high demand and I need to ensure a reasonable return on my investment. However, if we can come to an agreement soon, I'm willing to consider 1150 Euros per month, but only until the end of this week. After that, I might have to rent it to another interested party.' This way, I'm making a minor concession while still emphasizing the urgency of the decision. Max might accept this offer or continue negotiating. The negotiation will terminate once an agreed-upon price is found or if no agreement can be made.
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: As Max Müller, I would assess the situation and consider the new offer while also being mindful of my financial limitations. I might respond with: 'Thank you for your understanding, Mr. Schmidt. While 1150 Euros per month is still a significant expense for me, it does bring us closer to a mutually agreeable price. I'll need a day or two to evaluate my finances and decide if I can commit to this amount. Can I get back to you by Thursday?' This allows me to buy some time to consider the offer while still showing interest in the apartment. The negotiation continues until an agreement is reached or terminated.
name: Max Müller from Germany

content: As Peter Schmidt, while trying to close the deal as soon as possible but still somewhat accommodating Max's request, I could respond: 'Mr. Müller, I appreciate your honesty and I'm glad we are making progress towards an agreement. However, as I mentioned earlier, this attractive offer will only be valid until the end of this week. If we can finalize the rental agreement by Thursday, I'll be happy to reserve this apartment for you. But if I receive another serious offer before then, I may have to give it careful consideration. Please let me know as soon as you make your decision.' This way, I'm emphasizing the urgency while still giving Max some time to decide. The negotiation will terminate once they accept the offered price or if no agreement can be made.
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: As Max Müller, I would carefully consider the landlord's response and the time constraint. With the apartment's desirable features in mind and the potential risk of losing the opportunity, I might respond: 'Thank you, Mr. Schmidt, for your patience and understanding. I understand the limited-time nature of this offer and the importance of a swift decision. After discussing with a close friend who is well-versed in financial matters, I have decided that I will take the lease at 1150 Euros per month, but only if you can extend the deadline until next Tuesday to allow me to manage my finances properly. I hope this arrangement is acceptable to you.' This showing commitment to the apartment while asking for an extension of the deadline, the negotiation continues until they either accept the modified terms or terminate without an agreement.
name: Max Müller from Germany

content: As Peter Schmidt, while trying to maintain a sense of urgency but also considering Max's request for a slight extension, I could respond: 'Mr. Müller, I'm pleasantly surprised by your commitment to the apartment despite the tight deadline. However, as I previously mentioned, I have other interested parties to consider, and I can't extend the offer indefinitely. I'll make an exception this one time and extend the deadline until next Tuesday. But please note, if I receive a more compelling offer by then, I may have to reconsider my decision. I look forward to receiving your signed lease agreement by next Tuesday.' This way, I'm granting the extension but emphasizing the risk involved if Max takes too long to finalize the agreement. The negotiation will terminate upon receiving the signed lease agreement or if no agreement can be made before the new deadline. If no agreement is reached by Tuesday, both parties will likely move on to other options.
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: As Max Müller, I would express my gratitude for the extended deadline while reiterating my interest in the apartment. I might respond: 'Thank you very much, Mr. Schmidt, for your flexibility in this matter. I understand and respect the fact that you have other prospective tenants to consider. I'll make sure to submit the signed lease agreement promptly once I've arranged my financial situation accordingly. I'm looking forward to moving into this wonderful apartment.' This conveys my intentions to follow through while also acknowledging the potential competition for the apartment. The negotiation will end when the lease agreement is signed or if no agreement is reached by the new deadline.
name: Max Müller from Germany
